item.title: Dry weather likely
item.description: The Bangladesh Meteorological Department (BMD) has forecasted dry weather with partly cloudy sky across the country for the next 24 hours, beginning at 9:00 am today (Tuesday). "Light rain is likely to occur at one or two places over the Chattogram division. Weather may remain mainly dry with part

item.title: Man stabbed dead in Chuadanga clash
item.description: A man was killed and three others were injured in a clash between two groups of villagers at Gobindahuda village in Damurhuda upazila of Chuadanga district on Tuesday. The deceased was identified as Joynur, 53 of the village, reports UNB. Quoting local people, Humayun Kabir, officer-in-charge of

item.title: Businesses raise edible oil prices without government approval: Commerce Adviser
item.description: Commerce Adviser Sk Bashir Uddin on Tuesday said businesses have increased edible oil prices without the government's approval, which is beyond their authority. "The government has not raised edible oil prices, nor has it given any permission to businesses to do so. Businesses do not have the auth

item.title: No scope for NCP to get ‘shapla’ symbol: EC Secretary
item.description: Election Commission (EC) Senior Secretary Akhtar Ahmed has said that the National Citizen Party (NCP) will not be allotted the ‘Shapla’ (water lily) symbol. The party has been asked to select an alternative symbol and inform the commission by October 19. “If the NCP fails to choo

item.title: Process to receive bail bonds online begins Wednesday: Asif Nazrul
item.description: Law, Justice and Parliamentary Affairs Adviser Dr Asif Nazrul on Tuesday said the process of receiving bail bonds online will begin on a trial basis tomorrow (Wednesday), enabling bail documents to reach prisons directly with a single click. “After a person secures bail, there are reportedly
